intro: Perostema sanguinea, commonly known as redstem false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
